Name: Pentamid
Description:
Pentamid is a two-player game played on a Volcano (5X5) board with one partial stash per player. The objective is for a player to be the first to get five of his pieces in a row, horizontally or vertically.

Each player starts with twelve pieces, four each of each of the three sizes. These pieces are arranged in nests off the board (the "reserve").

Rules Link

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces

Name: Pach-Ice-i
Description:
Pach-Ice-i is a race-to-the-finish game for two players based mostly on pachisi. The objective is for a player to get all of his pieces to the opponent's starting pad before the opponent gets all of his pieces to the player's starting pad.

Rules Link

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces

Name: Par-Trees-i
Description:
Par-Trees-i is a game for two or four players using one Treehouse stash, a Volcano board and an ordinary six-sided die. The objective is to be the first player to get all three of his pieces to the center, in decreasing size order.

Rules Link

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces

Name: UNO: A Charlie Brown Valentine
Description:
Another Uno variation. This features the theme of A Charlie Brown Valentine.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Secret Valentine" card, which lets you look into your opponent's heart (and hand) and gives you an advantage in planning your moves
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: QUATRO: A Multiplication Game
Description:
"Quatro is an exciting new math game designed to develop the child's ability to recognize the products of two numbers. Quatro reinforces the multiplication operation of math."

Players win by correctly placing four chips in a row, or by covering all four corners of the board.

Includes colorful game board, 50 cards, and 26 plastic chips.

Ideal School Supply Company No. 7713

Name: Sodbusters
Description:
The thematic setting of the game is the North American prairie as it was first being settled in the late 1800's and early 1900's.

The object of the game is to build the most profitable farming operation.  Each player starts with a cash loan and one of 57 available sections of land, and may buy more land on any turn.  On each section of land, players may plant one of four crops or raise one of four kinds of livestock. 
 Each turn represents one of the four seasons.  The game consists of 20 turns (five "years" or full crop cycles).  Each turn or season is divided into 3 phases which are played simultaneously by all players.  In the "Purchase" phase players may buy land and animals and (if in season) plant crops.  The "Event" phase consists of drawing cards which introduce events or conditions which may or may not affect players.  For example, when a Tornado or Oil Strike event is drawn, a die roll mechanism is used to select specific land sections which are affected. In the "Harvest" phase, players sell any mature crops or livestock at the market price listed on a master Harvest card drawn for that turn.

Players may pay off their initial loan at any time.  The amount due (representing combined principal and interest) grows substantially each "year".  After the final turn, the player with the most cash left after paying off the loan is the winner.  Land and other permanent farming assets may not be sold to raise cash.  This simulates the practice of the first generation retiring and handing the farming operation intact to the next generation.

The game mechanism allows for solitaire play, in which the object would be to record a personal best amount of cash at the end.  The primary effect of introducing more players is the competition for prime farmland.  The length of play is not affected greatly since each phase is played simultaneously by all.  Game testing showed a substantial increase in speed of play after players had played 2-3 times.  For a game in which most or all players are novices, allow 4 hours.

Although the game includes a substantial amount of luck (farmers cannot control weather or market prices) it cannot be won by luck alone.  Successful players will learn how to best farm different types of land (it is not all equal), manage risk, and select appropriate crop or livestock strategies (the various options include a wide range of risk/reward trade offs).

The game could be used in an educational setting either to illustrate the historical settling of the prairies or to demonstrate the basics of investing in any context (managing risk, balancing a portfolio, using leverage, etc.)

Name: Reise Durch das Bistum Osnabrück
Description:
From the box--

Kurzbeschreibung: Das Spiel zeigt das Bistum Osnabrück mit vielen wichtigen und interessanten Orten. Es will Eindrücke und Wissen vermittein. Gleichzeitig ist das Spiel ein schönes Gemeinschaftserlebnis für Kinder, Jugendgruppen und die gesamte Familie.

There are cards with this kind of phrase on them: Zähle Frauenorden auf, die in unserem Bistum tätig sind. Je 2 Punkte.

And larger cards with pictures and information about the pictures. Player pawns and one green die.

It seems to be a tour of memorable sites in Osnabrück, with a point system.

Name: Beyond Chess
Description:
Beyond Chess is a chess variant that uses a modular gameboard that actually shifts during play.  Rather than playing on an 8×8 grid, the game is played on 64 movable squares.

Players can move pieces as well as game squares, causing an ever changing landscape of movement possibilities.  Furthermore, it is possible to entirely isolate an opponent's playing piece, thus rendering it immobile.

Name: StarRunners
Description:
You control a small fleet of spaceships, as does your opponent. Your task is simple: you must maneuver your fleet across the galaxy to your opponent's star system. Along the way, all of your ships must stop at a difficult-to-reach system called Backwater. It's a friendly race, so you can't actually attack the other player, but there are ways you can try to slow them down. Who will get there first?

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 3rd Competition

Name: WreckTangle
Description:
WreckTangle is a designed for Icehouse Pyramids. Players form a rectangle with their pyramids and capture pieces on the edge of the rectangle or the interior. A player is eliminated when three of her pieces have been captured. The object is to be the last player left in the game.

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - 2nd place in 7th Competition

Name: Reach
Description: Reach is an LDS card game. The game features two identical decks of 80 cards, each featuring a scripture from The Bible, The Book of Mormon, The Doctrine and Covenants, or the Pearl of Great Price. One deck is spread on the table face up and the other is given to "a reader." This player reads the scripture on a card from his/her and then the other players race to find it on the table. After all 80 cards are read, the player who found the most face up cards is the winner.

Name: Lieber Nachbar
Description: Each player moves 6 pawns on the board. No die is necessary because the pawns moves as far as the number of the field allows. The game is over when one player losses all of their pawns. The winner is the left neighbor of the player who has lost all pawns.

Name: New Faces Game
Description:
Based on the popular 1970's UK TV show, this game gave families the chance to audition and star in their own show in the comfort of their own home!
The aim of the game was to get your act through an audition for the "New Faces" TV show, and then move on to the Star Circuit.  The winner is the first player to accumulate £20,000, after safely negotiating all three circuits of the board.

Name: Bible Trivia
Description:
Answer a question correctly on your turn, then roll the die and move along the path.  When you land on a Judgment space, draw a card and follow its directions.  First player to reach Finish wins.

There are separate question cards for Children and Adults.  Each card's questions all relate to one theme rather than coming from different categories.

Not to be confused with the earlier game Bible Trivia also published by Cadaco.

Name: Rise of Rome: Republican Rome at War – Field of Glory Gaming Companion
Description:
The first army supplement for the Field of Glory: Ancient and Medieval Wargaming Rules miniatures wargame.  This supplement covers the armies of Republican Rome as well as their allies and enemies.  There are eighteen separate lists, each with a sample starter army and point cost chart for making your own force.

The book itself is 72 pages printed in full color with photos of miniatures and paintings from various other Osprey books used throughout.

Armies included:
- Mid-Republican Roman
- Late Republican Roman
- Gallic
- Pyrrhic
- Later Carthaginian
- Illyrian
- Ancient Spanish
- Later Macedonian
- Attalid Pergamene
- Numidian or Early Moorish
- Later Seleucid
- Later Ptolemaic
- Pontic
- Spartacus Slave Revolt
- Early Armenian
- Parthian
- Later Jewish
- Bosporan

Name: Van Dale Familiespel
Description:
Every player chooses a hidden word, they try to collect the letters which make up this word. In the mean time the other players try to guess the word of the other players. If they guess it correctly they have to think of a new word and start again.
The player who is the first to collect his letters is the winner.

Name: Moon Shot
Description:
A game about racing to the Moon and back, while avoiding pitfalls that open up in the board during play.

Components: 
- 8 wooden pawns in 4 colours (red, green, yellow, blue)
- A 14" square board with a spinner, showing concentric zones players travel through (Launch Pad - Entry - Orbit - Moon Landing - Orbit - Re-entry - Safe Landing on Earth). The board has 40 holes in it, with a separate cardboard disc underneath. The bottom disc has 21 holes and can be rotated incrementally so through-and-through holes open and close in the board as they match up.

Players have two pawns each, spin to see who starts (this is the only function of the spinner in the game), then move one space at a time from Launch Pad through the different zones, then back to Earth. If he lands on a hole in the "Orbit" zone that shows a dot in his colour, he can "shoot the Space Gun" (rotate the bottom disc one space left or right using a finger hole). This will make some new holes open and others close in the board, and any pawns falling through new holes must begin again. The winner is the first player to have both his pawns complete the journey to the Moon and back again.

Box says this game was based on "Outer Space Station #1" by Abel-Klinger, a game publisher in West Germany.

Name: Fancy Nancy Posh Bedroom Game
Description: Players compete to help Fancy Nancy transform her bedroom from plain to posh! Players bring in her boas, ribbons, tiaras and other fancy accessories....the first player to complete the posh bedroom makeover,wins! Based on the best selling children's picture books by Jane O'Connor. 2 to 4 players.  Game Contents: 1 Color Die, 4 Bedroom Game Boards,40 Posh Cards, including: 14 Purple "Let's Get Fancy!" Cards,18 Pink "Accessories!" Cards,8 Blue "Oops!" Cards

Name: Fancy Nancy Card Game
Description: A children's set collecting game based on the best selling children's picture books by Jane O'Connor.  Players pass cards looking to collect the 8 "posh" accessories for Nancy needed to win.  48 cards. 3 to 6 players

Name: Passing the Buck
Description:
Four forty piece jigsaw puzzles are muddled together and the pieces shared amongst the players.  
Each player has a screen (like a DM screen in RPG's), with a colour picture of the Western themed jigsaw that they must race the other players to complete.  Each person's puzzle is different, and so the players must swap pieces by bribery or auction style to win the pieces they need.
Because no-one can see the other players jigsaws, it becomes tense as the race to complete becomes frantic!

Name: Monopoly: Michael Graves Wooden Keepsake
Description: This is a redesign of the classic game Monopoly by design artist Michael Graves, and distributed exclusively in Target stores.  The game is smaller than a typical Monopoly board, and as such, so are the title deeds, chance and community chest cards, and bank notes,  The houses and hotels are also redesigned in the Michael Graves style, and come in velvet pouches for storage when not in use.  The tokens are based on the designs that Mr. Graves has submitted to Target for different household items (Cup & Saucer, Telephone, Wall Clock, Blender, Tea Kettle, and Toaster).  And this all is enclosed in a very attractive wood box.  The board folds open on the top like the top of a cigar or jewelery box, with side supports that swing out from the back, and there is a drawer on the side to store the tokens, buildings, cards, deeds, and money.  This drawer functions as Money rack when playing the game.

Name: Vertigo: The Balancing Puzzle
Description:
A game whereby the players attempt to balance components to make a mobile structure which is rather Alexander Calder in feel.

Components include:
1. Tube which both holds the game pieces when not in use and which also provides the base and initial pivot point,
2.central support pieces which balance on top of each other
3. stiff wires that are projected from the central support pieces.
4."c" shaped weights to hang off of the wires or each other.
The central supports will only balance if the wires and weights are properly balanced.

The goal is to get all the pieces on to the structure without it collapsing.

On the tube it says, "A dizzying experience awaits he who challenges Vertigo . . . but the reward is a gently floating mobile sculpture.

Steady hands and a keen sense of balance help you to hit upon the right combination of weights and counterweights which complete all levels of the puzzle.  Vertigo - the puzzle that thinks it's art."

Name: Thomas Count Your Cars Game
Description:
From the manufacturer's catalog:

A preschool counting and color matching game! Match the number of boxcars shown on the spinner to the colored cards in hand... then head for the roundhouse and pick up the matching color engine to haul those boxcars into your scoring pile. The player with the most boxcars wins!

For Ages 3 and up.

Includes 36 boxcar cards, game board, spinner, and 4 engine tokens.
Families: TV Shows: Thomas the Tank Engine

Name: Fundomino
Description:
Wild Action Dominoes!

Fundomino combines the best of fun and the best of domino. Are you ready for the action?
Place an action tile at the end of the chain and it immediately comes into effect. Who will get to
have another turn, draw extra tiles, reverse the order or gain extra points?
Arrow Symbol = Play Again! 
Plus Symbol = Draw! 
Star Symbol = Wild!
Be the first to play all your Fundominoes to win. Fundomino is the best domino party game to gather family and friends together for hours of fun!

The game comes with 32 fundominoes, 4 pawns, and a scoring track.

Name: Double Shutter Junior
Description:
From the manufacturer:

Double Shutter Junior doubles the family fun.
Roll the dice and add up the dots to shut the tiles of your choice. The tile total must match the dot total in any combination you want. This fun family game helps develop math skills while being fast to learn and easy to play.

Double Shutter Junior comes with a double shutter box that has two rows of 6 tiles each, rather than the 9 that the original version comes with. Includes two dice.

Ages 6 and up

Name: Ripleys Believe It or Not! Library of Cards
Description:
This is a compact library of the strange and fascinating oddities of the world, all authenticated by Ripley. These cards are enjoyable to adults as to children of all ages.

The exciting feature of these cards is the game of Ripley Rummy that can be enjoyed by the whole family. Follows the traditional rules of the popular Rummy card game. Be the first to get rid of all your cards by collecting and playing sets of cards.

Name: Goofball Rally
Description:
Publishers Description:

"It’s time for Goofball Rally, the fast-paced, color-matching marble race! Place your goofballs on the starting line and get ready to go. On your mark, get set…roll! Launch your goofballs one by one down the winding race tracks. When all of your goofballs have crossed the finish line, hit the red button. The first player to score 20 points is the Goofball Rally Champ! Includes goofball stadium game board, 10 race cards, and 20 goofball racers (in 10 bright colors). For 2 players."

Name: C.O.W. (Cybernetic Omni-tasking Workcow)
Description:
C.O.W. or Cybernetic Omni-tasking Workcow is a board game that is similar to a 1980's computer game called M.U.L.E.
  
Players start by purchasing a land of out of a pool.  They can also buy workcows to farm the land to produce the resources.  During the market phase, players buy or sell the resources to other players or the store to make profit or simply to keep their farm running.

Players must also deal with random events that may effect their production and at the same time, they must be cunning enough to survive the brutal market manipulation by other players.

Ultimately, the first player who reaches a specific wealth wins the game.

Name: Dice: The Evolution
Description:
From the game's rules:

This is a game designed to be fun. You have dice, you’re going to play with them anyway.
Now you have a goal.

Make dice towers, roll high numbers, spin dice, and evolve.

Players start out with the d4, and fight their way up through the evolutionary chain of dice; d4 -> d6 -> d8 -> d10 -> d12 -> d20

The game is made up of two different sections in each evolution; the quests, and the challenge.

    Quests are undertaken in order to obtain bonuses to rolls which can be used in any of the upcoming challenges.
    Challenges are undertaken when the player feels they have enough bonuses to defeat the next die in the evolutionary chain of dice.

Name: Ripley's Believe It or Not!
Description:
The Story Card is read aloud.  Players choose to Believe It or Not!   Those who choose correctly move the number of spaces shown on the card.
 The Ripley's Believe It or Not Game takes you through the mysterious halls of Ripley's Museum where you will encounter unique treasures from around the world.
 Land on an Exhibit Space and hear a wild tale about the exhibit you are shown.  Do you Believe it or Not?  Answer correctly and keep the card.

Win!
Collect an Exhibit Card from each room, be the first to exit the museum, and Win!

Name: Ripley's Believe It or Not! Game
Description: Players travel the world collecting visas from 7 continents  by guessing if bizarre, fun "facts" are really from Robert Ripley's incredible Believe It or Not! archives. Once they collect all 7 visas, players try to obtain an exhibit card by answering a photo card correctly, so they can be the first player to open a Ripley's Believe It or Not! Museum and win the game.

Name: Martian Coaster Chaturanga
Description:
Martian Coaster Chaturanga is a game for two or four players using a Treehouse set and a set of Martian Coasters. Players move and capture pieces on the board, with the objective of having the greatest number of points at the end of the game.

Rules Link

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 6th Competition

Name: UNO: Brian Urlacher Special Edition
Description:
An Uno variation themed on Brian Urlacher, star football  player for the NFL Chicago Bears Football team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "MLB" (i.e. Middle LineBacker) card and rule.

Name: Oktawars
Description:
Oktawars is the official prequel of Oktagrid.
In the box you'll find over 60 pawns, towers, sheets, dices, special tokens and a wooden modular board, a quick reference sheet and, obviously, the game rules.

Let's see the story of the game...

Once upon a time, there were eight Mages.
They lived on the Island of An, ruling eight realms, and battling each other in small skirmishes...
A great war seemed unavoidable...

And the game begins.

To avoid the great, final battle, Pedramor the White, Keeper of Peace and  Master of Light, begins to create a powerful artifact, a boardgame named Oktagrid: if activated, every attack spell will be immediately countered, depriving all the Mages of their primary offensive weapon.

But, before the activation of the Oktagrid, two Mages are suddenly killed.
Raksha the Red spreads war all over the land, trying to dominate the entire island, and someone steal the artifact from Pedramor's tower.

The Mages begins a desperate fight one against each other, trying to find and activate or destroy the Oktagrid.

Players take place of the six remaining Mages, to try to save - or conquer - the Island of An.
The game has a multiple-level strategy: winning battles is important as taking the control of strategic areas, and even the search for the Oktagrid takes a heavy role, since the activation or the destruction of the artifact is the only way to end the match.

Every Mage has his special abilities and spells: each wizard fights in a personal way, being selfish and destructive, or protecting and aiding his troops, or even focusing in teleporting soldiers or making them walk underwater.

The game has very original mechanics and a unique setting; game rules are easy to learn but challenging to master in the most effective way.

Name: Kontact
Description:
Using their wooden playing pieces (40 each), players race to complete 10 buildings before their opponent.  Pieces are placed on the board in contact with a piece of the opposing colour.  When enough pieces are in play, those on the board can be stacked atop opposing pieces, or other pieces may be brought into play.  A player may complete a building building if the topmost piece is his.

Can be played in teams of 2 or 3 each with an additional set.

Name: Start de Persen!
Description:
Start the Printers:

You are a chief-editor of a major national newspaper and have to fill all 5 sections of your paper with news. You collect the news by moving over the gameboard and answering trivia. You can also steal news from another newspaper. When you have filled all the sections you have to deliver your paper to the printing-plant.
The game is like Trivial Pursuit with a newspaper theme.
Nice touch is that the dice is 2 times 5, the gameboard is a pentagon and the player pawn is a chair.

Subtitle of the game: Het verrrassende 5 krantenspel.

This game was produced as part of the celebration of 400 years of newspapers. The papers featured in this game are 5 major national newspapers of the netherlands: Volkskrant, NRC Handelsblad, Parool, trouw and Algemeen Dagblad.

Name: Top Of The Pops Game
Description:
The object of Top of The Pops is to be the most successful manager by achieving 1 million record sales from your pop acts, and thereby winning the gold disc.  The number of acts you get onto the charts and how high they reach establishes your sales levels.

Contents:
Playing board spinner
Top Ten chart
Record contract cards
Record release cards
Chart News cards
Sales cards
Pop Act tabs (plus blanks)
Silver discs
Gold disc
Radio Plug cards

Name: Gary Lineker's Footballer of the Year
Description:
A game based around Gary Lineker, a celebrated footballer from Leicester, England, and his rise through the footballing ranks to become the superstar of football that he did.  (Note; he is still famous as a presenter of football on TV)
The object of the game is to play the football matches to the best of your ability and try to attain as much money and as many football awards as possible.  The game starts with each player being a fourth division footballer with just £500 in savings and no status.

Game Contents:
1 Playing board
1 Footballer marker
40 playing tokens
4 match score dice (red, yellow, 2 x green)
1 skill dice (white)
1 win or lose dice (black)
5 cup dice
1 pack incident cards
1 points score pad
cheques
1 set rules

Name: The United States Air Mail Game
Description:
Not to be confused with the card game Wings: The Air Mail Game (also known as Aviation: The Air Mail Game).

The United States Air Mail Game is a board game that features a picture of a blue airplane on the front and a map of the USA on the board with metal airplane for playing pieces.
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: The Garrison Game
Description: In this early abstract wargame, 50 soldiers need to move across the board and capture a fortress held down by 3 officers.  The board consists of colored diamonds connected by lines, presumably for point-to-point movement.  The box front displays the title prominently with several flags and a couple of cannons.

Name: Skyscraper
Description:
This early Parker Brothers Game might be one of the earliest games (outside of Bingo) to give each player their own board.  Everyone is trying to develop their own district with residences, churches, public buildings, and a 5-story skyscraper.  The components include painted/colored wood blocks for the buildings!

The designer published the game himself, and then Parker Brothers bought it and reprinted it. It is not known if the two versions differ.

Name: Jeu de l'histoire sainte depuis la naissance de Moïse jusqu'à sa mort
Description:
This game is literally a work of art.

It's a French game about the life of Moses from circa 1800 where the gameboard is engraved on a copper plate.  There are 62 small engraved images, one in each of the spaces of the movement track.  The gameboard has a movement track that spirals in toward the center of the board in an oval.  The game instructions are in French in the center of the oval.

The board sold for $535 in Feb 2008.

Name: Timelock
Description:
Someone's gone and broken the TimeLine again.

An agent of the Time Repair Agency, you must create a Timelock to stop the TimeLine from arbitrarily changing. When everything went haywire, an alternate version of yourself was created. If your alter-ego sets their Timelock first, they will take your place in the TimeLine and vice-versa. Once it's done, who is the real you?

Timelock is a 2-player semi-abstract strategy game where players race to match Stacks of pyramids to their Goal... before their Goal changes, that is. Players will need two Treehouse sets (ideally one Rainbow set and one Xeno set), two 6-sided dice, one Treehouse die, and a Volcano board or other 5x5 square board.

Rules Link

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - 3rd place in 7th Competition

Name: Pari
Description: Players add cards to mathematical equations in the middle of the table. A player who can complete a correct equation scores points. A player who cannot achieve this will add cards to existing equations to make them more complex and harder to complete for other players. Cards are either number cards (one digit, can be combined to form higher numbers) or operator cards (=, +, -, x, /).

Name: UNO: LaDainian Tomlinson Special Edition
Description:
An Uno variation themed on LaDainian Tomlinson , star running back for the National Football League San Diego Chargers Team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "MVP" card and rule commemorating Tomlinson's selection as the NFL's Most Valuable Player

Name: UNO: Los Angeles Lakers Legends Edition
Description:
An Uno variation based on great players from the National Basketball Association (NBA) team, the Los Angeles Lakers.  Cards feature Hall of Famers and championship winners including Shaquille O'Neal, Magic Johnson, Jerry West, James Worthy, Kareem Abdul-Jabaar & more.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Has an exclusive "SHOWTIME!" card & rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno.

Name: UNO: New York Knicks
Description:
An Uno variation themed on the National Basketball Association (NBA) team, the New York Knicks

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Dunk" card and rule commemorating John Starks'  1993 driving, left-handed tomahawk slam.

Name: Timberland
Description:
Timberland is a Treehouse-meets-Volcano game for 2-4 players. Players perform Treehouse actions on shared pieces scattered about a Volcano board until they collect enough points to win. Themewise, think of this as cultivating hardwood trees, and then sending out logging crews to harvest the fully grown trees, thinning out the forest over time.

The rules are available on the IcehouseGames Wiki.

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 7th Competition

Name: Le Jeu Joli
Description:
La Jeu Joli uses a board with four main areas (starting spots, outer ring, middle ring and center/finish), with other paths which connect the these areas.  The game uses the blockade and capturing concepts of Pachisi.

Players may move in either direction on their turn and may move the number indicated by one die or both dice.  A player may move from one path to the next and into the finish circle only over his colored path.  The first player to get all his markers to the finish circle wins.

Name: Kolardo: A Space Age Classic
Description:
From the rules: Kolardo will fascinate and entertain all who play, and at the same time will unfold the beautiful and subtle, yet simple language of COLOUR.  Produced for ASCIA by Neil John Productions Ltd., New Zealand.

Basic Information: The Kolardo Pack comes with 54 cards representing 9 colours (3 primary, 1 secondary, and 5 tertiary colours), a rule book, and a rule card for advanced play.  The basic concept of the game is capturing melds of secondary and tertiary colours by playing and discarding cards to the piles next to the draw stack.

Name: Auktion
Description:
In this game of auctions and dice the players try to amass the greatest fortune by buying cars in auctions, and then earning money on these by being lucky in their dice rolls.

The game consists of: 
- Twenty cars: Eight blue, ten red, and two gold.
- Money: In denominations from 100 to 5000.
- A Gavel: For the auction master.
- Bonds: Six for each player.

The players are given 23.500 in cash and six bonds ranging from 1000 to 6000.

The game consists of 20 rounds where the cars are sold to the players and money are earned or lost.

First the eight blue cars and then the two gold cars are sold:


     Auction the cars. The highest bidder takes the car and pays the bank. 



     Roll dice. Every player roll their two dice.


The players then either pay or get money from bank according to the roll:

Series (N, N+1): The player adds the dice and times this with the added up value of the cars (100 and 200). The sum is paid from the bank to the player.

Even (N, N): The player can sell the N bond to the bank. It is possible to trade with other players for this.

Tax (Anything else): The player pays tax to the bank: Number of cars times times the value of the cars (100 and 200).

Then the ten red cars are given away.


     Each player rolls the dice, and the player with the highest roll is given a red car. Players also pay or recieve money as above.


When the last car has been given away, the players add up their cash, subtract their remaining bonds, and add up the value of their cars: 5.000 for blue and red, and 10.000 for gold.

The winner is the player with the largest fortune.

Name: Seikkailu Merellä
Description:
"Adventure at Sea - The great submarine hunt"

An abstract naval strategy game for 2 players. One player is the submarine commander and controls a mothership-submarine and nine mini-subs; the other is the surface commander and controls a fleet of sixteen destroyers. The board has an asymmetric (roughly 10 by 16) grid on which the vessels move; initial setup is printed on the board and is always the same.

There are several exit points at the edges of the grid. The goal of the submarine commander is to take the mothership off the board through an exit point; the surface commander tries to prevent this and capture the mothership. (For the purpose of the victory condition, the mini-subs and destroyers are expendable.) Both sides can capture the other's vessels by sandwiching an enemy vessel between two of their own. Captured vessels are removed from the game.

The board also has several "military secrets"; by placing any of his vessels on such a space the sub commander forces the surface commander to remove one destroyer (her choice).

The game includes one rules variant.

Similar to:

     Hnefatafl

Name: Zakochany w Warszawie
Description: Historical game about Warsaw published by Warsaw City Hall. Game is about tourists sightseeing in the city. One of them gets lost and others are looking for him.

Name: The Nanchang Rebellion
Description:
This game is the first in the Oriental Flagship Company's "Red Remembrances" series.  This simple game simulates the August 1, 1927 Nanchang Rebellion, when Communist forces first rebelled against the Kuomintang.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanchang_Uprising
The game uses roughly 40 magnetic counters on a board with a hexagonal grid, a die, and a set of event cards.  According to the semi-hidden movement rules, counters only reveal their equipment and capabilities when discovered according to the rules.

Name: Caldiero 1796
Description:
A free game by Kevin Zucker and Enrico Acerbi, and a  Napoleon’s Last Battles System variant published by Italian wargame magazine "No Turkeys" (and available in PDF at their website).

The game simulates Bonaparte's attack on the numerically superior Coalition forces under Austrian General Josef Alvintzy.  Alvintzy defeated the Little Corporal in this prelude to Bonaparte's victory at Arcola in the following days.

The map scale is about 1:30,000 with each hex being 480 meters (or 525 yards) across. Unit sizes are mostly regiments for infantry and cavalry with several artillery batteries combined  to form each "demi-brigade" of cannon.  Special rules to depict leadership capabilities of individual generals.

Available online (see weblinks below).

GAME SYSTEM: Napoleon's Last Battles (NLB-Series) 
- scale = 480m/hex, 
- time = 1hour/GT,
- strength = 150-500 men/SP.
Families: Series: The Library of Napoleonic Battles (OSG)

Name: Davy Crockett
Description:
Object of this card game is to take trick containing the main character cards depicting RED STICK, GENERAL JACKSON, GEORGE RUSSEL and last but not least DAVY CROCKETT.

Trick taking follows special rules, a complete game ends after 6 rounds, scoring only the cards in the tricks containing the above mentioned characters.

Game hails from the heydays of the company regarding card artwork: 44 cards with brightly coloured pictures are a joy to play...

Name: Punch and Judy
Description:
This is a Rummy Game variant with 34 cards in the pack.

Object of the game is to be the first to dispose of all the cards in hand by laying down a set or sets of 3 or 4 of the same character. 
Name giving characters of Punch and Judy can be used as Jokers.

Cards are significantly smaller than usual card games and of a lesser component quality than most of the Pepys card games, albeit the print quality is stunning !

Name: Victory
Description:
This is a clever game of setting up collections.

Regarding the time it was published, the theme of the game and last but not least the comic strip caricatures of Churchill, Hitler and some other populars of the time this is one of the rarest and for the collector most expensive game from the Pepys company.

Object of the game is to secure points for merit. This is done by rising in the services (Army, Navy, Air Force and Home Services) in proper sequences, avoiding to include one of the penalty villains of Hitler-ruled Germany.

Clever card drafting and discarding rules coupled with nail-biting decision when to end a round (enhance your set or take the risk to draw a penalty) is even by modern standards a good game.

By the time this game was published the card quality was very high: thick cardboard with linen finish and brightly coloured printing add to the flair of the game.

Name: Scouting
Description:
11 sets of 4 cards each have to be played to gain as many points as possible by making up various scoring combinations.
This can be done by:
- making up the total of "12"
- playing cards of the same number
- playing runs and/or sequences
- playing the Baden Powell card
- being the last player in the round

Game ends after several rounds until a player has a total score of 30 points.
One of the most demanding games of the Pepys series regarding the rules, and very special because 11 can play without using a second deck of cards !

The educational aspect of the Scouting theme is accompanied by extensive description of the subjects of the cards on the last pages of the rules booklet.

As usual with this publisher printing quality and graphic artwork is outstanding.

Name: Girl
Description:
A trick-taking card game with cards depicting the original comic strip characters from the "Girl"-comic magazine from the 1950ies.

It consists of 12 heroine cards, 30 trio cards and two girl cards.

Object of the game is to win cards as much as possible, using the girl-cards as jokers.

Gameplay is the same as in the PLANES GAME and the CARS GAME from the same publisher and somewhat special, using the trio-cards in prominent role.

Short-time fun for the whole family with the exceptionally well printed cards in top quality.

Name: I Commit
Description:
Card game where players score points for assembling three-card "crimes", or playing three-card "arrests" to foil crimes already on the table.

Game consists of 53 cards, and players win by disposing of the cards in their hand, collecting as many counters as possible while doing so. Players can play the following melds of cards:

- commit a crime (criminal + motive + opportunity)
- arrest a criminal (constable + inspector + clue)
- declaring a posse of inspectors (any 3 inspector cards)
- founding a police college (any 6 constable cards)
- exposing a nest of criminals (any 6 criminal cards)

When a player empties their hand, they score points according to the cards remaining in their opponent's hand.

Card graphics must rank in the top 5 of all the games published by Pepys. There were two editions of this game, the latter including redesigned Police Constable cards. The first saw a realistic policeman, in the second, he was replaced by a cartoon policeman, with the number 49 on his collar, possibly in reference to the contemporary radio series "PC 49".

Name: Quien Sabé
Description:
A lesser known card game from the famous company although the rules state: "Quien Sabé has created the greatest sensation in games since our celebrated game of PIT".

A fast-paced game where every player gets an identical set of cards.

The leading player calls "down", and every participant chooses a card from his set and hides it from the others.
When the leading player calls "up" all cards are revealed simultaneously.
The object for each player now is to capture tricks in hopes that he may secure thereby a number of "count cards": Cards numbered 5, 10, 15 from the cowboy cards and Quien Sabé, the last mentioned being a special card.

Game is won after several rounds when a player has amassed at least 500 points.

Name: Speedihound
Description:
Game is presumably from the 1950ies and a greyhound racing betting game.

It consists of 6 x 8 suits of greyhound cards and one hare card.
Added is a rubber gameboard, enforced with raw canvas which also depicts the rules of the game.

Place your bets - and then one card after the other is turned up from the shuffled deck until one dog has laid out all his cards. Should the last card be the "disqualified" the dog is exactly that !

Can be played by any number of players as long everyone has counters (or money?) to bet...

Name: Transcott
Description:
Sub-Title of the game is:" Jeu des Routes du Ciel" which means in English: "Game of the Routes of the Sky".

It depicts the Lockheed "Super Constellation" on the box lid and is a trick taking game with special designed cards, depicting several service personnel from airlines on the time (1950ies).

Object of the game is to collect the cards to travel several air routes around the world.
To achieve this the cards not only depict suit and rank but also stops along the travel line.
The routes are shown on a separate gameboard.

Cards and box have luxury outfit: Thick cardboard cards with top and colourful printing quality, the box with lizzard skin finish and golden borders - nice !

Name: Pinocchio
Description:
Game consists of 45 cards, divided into 5 sets of 9, each set depicting various scenes from the movie film of the time and additional one of the letters of the characters name (Pinocchio).

Object of the game is to get rid of the cards in hand as fast as possible.
To reach this goal cards have to be laid out in a certain pattern, letter cards "N" acting as special jokers.

First player to get rid of his cards scores according to the cards left in the other players hands.

Game ends after several rounds when a player has scored 250 or more points.

Thick cardboard cards with linen finish and top printing quality add to the fun to play this fast paced, light card game.

Name: Captain Cook: Voyage of Discovery
Description:
Captain Cook : Voyage of Discovery is a simple roll & move educational game produced by Studio Press and the NSW Parks & Wildlife Service in 1969. The box proclaims:

'Relive the perils of Cook's historic first voyage...watch out for unfriendly natives...unfavourable winds...dangerous reefs and look forwards to exciting discovery unlimited..'

Players win the game by being the first to get their 'Endeavour' from the Portsmouth, England, to Botany Bay in Australia.  The players move forward or backwards around the board track according to the cards that are drawn in sequence. No dice are used.

Players in the game are drafted randomly into several different roles of the Endeavour: Bosun, 1st Mate, Joseph Banks, and of course Captain Cook.  Cook has a few privileges and winners of the race get to play him in other rounds of the game. Cook moves first and is essentially the dealer.

The game comes with an educational supplement published by the NSW Parks & Wildlife Service. The playing cards also contain illustrations and facts about some of the Flora & Fauna of New South Wales, Australia.

The game also came with 'historic cut out medals' that players were encouraged to pin on themselves in order to add the element of role-play.

Name: UNO: Tom Brady NFL Greatest Players
Description:
An Uno variation themed on Tom Brady, star quarterback for the National Football League New England Patriots Team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Passer" card and rule which does not correlate to any card/rule in regular Uno.

Name: UNO: Hairspray
Description:
Themed Uno game based on the the movie musical, "Hairspray"

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Swap Partners" card and rule, which allows you to swap hands with another player.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Fat Albert
Description:
Themed Uno game based on the the classic animated TV Show, "Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids"

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Brown Hornet Superhero" card and rule, which does not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: UNO: Texas
Description:
Themed Uno game based on the the state of Texas.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Last Stand" cards and rules (referring to last stand at the Alamo), which allows players to switch hands and does not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.

Name: UNO: Arsenal Highbury Legends
Description:
Themed Uno game based on the football (soccer) club, Arsenal Highbury.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Red Card" and "Yellow Card" cards and rules (referring to the card penalties given by players for infractions), which do not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.

Name: UNO: Derek Jeter Limited
Description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of Derek Jeter, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the New York Yankees.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Captain" card and rule (referring to Jeter's position as team captain), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

Name: UNO: David Ortiz Limited
Description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of David Ortiz, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the Boston Red Sox.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Big Papi" card and rule (referring to Ortiz's famous nickname), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

Name: UNO: Chicago White Sox
Description:
Another Uno variation. This features the theme of the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the Chicago White Sox

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Manager" card and rule, which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

Name: UNO: David Wright Special
Description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of David Wright, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the New York Mets.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Hot Corner" card and rule (referring to Wright's position at third base), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

Name: Pirate Ship
Description: Pirate Ship is a game that tests players balancing and identifying skills.  Players have to fit the components without making the ship topple, or do their best to make the opponents topple it!

Name: Double Talk
Description:
Contents:

     Deck of 65 letter cards
     4 player boards
     2 dice
     Instruction booklet


Deal the cards onto the spaces provided on each player's board.  On your turn, a dice roll determines in which spaces you may switch cards or draw for a replacement.  The first player to form two four-letter words on his board wins the round and scores the points in those words.  Play a series of rounds until someone reaches the total required to win the game.

Name: American Kennel Club Best in Show Board Game
Description:
From the publisher:

The ultimate game of canine contests! With this board game, you choose the breed, register your dog, and enter the most exciting canine show in town. You act as the dog handler and take your purebred through the course to win best of breed and ultimately best in show. Players roll the die and travel the board collecting facts and items to fill up their dog dish. Events in the center ring allow players to take their breeds through a fantasy dog show. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 6 and up.

Name: Hello Kitty Shopping Spree Game
Description:
From the publisher:

The ultimate game of friendship, shopping and sharing!

It’s a party for Tippy! Shop for a new outfit and buy a birthday present with this fun and fashionable Hello Kitty® board game. You can make ATM withdrawals, borrow money from friends, get discount coupons and even take express shuttles to your favorite stores! Be the quickest shopper as you collect your dress, shoes, handbag, hair accessory and gift so you can be dressed and at Tippy’s birthday party just in time to start the celebration!

Ages 7 and up
2-4 players

Name: Warfighter 101: Asian Thunder
Description:
(from publisher's website)

The Iranian push toward the Azeri capital of Baku has to go thru the border city of Salyan. As the Azeris and Iranians battle it out, the Russians and Americans both make cameos. Lots of open tank country surrounding a city that hugs a river, and makes for some challenging maneuver

Asian Thunder covers the opening battles of a hypothetical war between Iran and Azerbaijan.  On their march north, the Iranians must subdue the border city of Salyan, but the Azeris are defending on their home turf.

A challenging map has a swath or urban terrain along the river, with wide-open flanks.  Forces include Iranian and Azeri infantry, armor, recon, and attack helicopters.  Local insurgents, Russian paratroopers, and a company of American infantry also make appearances.

The Warfighter series brings modern maneuver combat to the tabletop at the tactical level.  Units are platoons and sections, with some individual vehicles and leaders. Counters are a robust 7/8" square, with values for firepower, armor, range, and movement, plus the occasional frontal armor of zone of control.  Maps are designed to correspond to US military maps, replacing 1000m grid squares with large hexes.  Scenarios are written as 5-paragraph-style Operations Orders, which are kept under wraps so neither player knows his opponents' exact mission.

Name: Orange Crush: Civil War in the Ukraine (Future Conflict Series)
Description:
(from publishers' website)

The Next Wars series brings battalion-level modern shooting wars to your tabletop. Combat units must synchronize attacks and defenses to maximize their collective combat power. Headquarters units coordinate actions on the battlefield and support battalions maintain supply lines. 
The Next Wars is scaled at 10km/hex, with 12-hour turns. Units are battalions, headquarters, and specialty companies.

Following a series of contentious elections in which both sides accused the other of support from outside the country, the Ukraine began to fracture.   What started as competing protest marches in the streets rapidly escalated into a shooting war between the different factions.   When the President of the Ukraine finally ordered the Army to restore order, several units revolted, and the President appealed to NATO for assistance. Ignoring Russian warnings against intervening, NATO provided a small UK-led force, which the Russians countered with a reinforced mechanized corps, plus reinforcements from their Belorussian allies.   The US sent their available forces to the Polish frontier, hoping that their deterrent effect would stabilize the situation. The Ukrainian "Interventionists" (so named for their favorability toward Russian "intervention") had organized their own fighting force around the two mechanized brigades (and assorted smaller units) that mutinied against the national command.   Russian operatives assisted in arming and organizing the "101 Brigade" from provinces near the border; other partisans throughout the Ukraine also took up arms on the Interventionist side.

The Ukrainian government incorporated their volunteers into the standing army, hoping to avoid any public relations backlash from having irregular forces on the battlefield, as they attempted to paint the conflict as a civil war in which the Russians were meddling and NATO were invited peacekeepers. The first battles were joined near Lvov, as the Interventionists bypassed Kiev and pushed as far west as possible, hoping to prevent the NATO forces from establishing a bridgehead in the Ukraine. Russian and Belorussian reinforcements arrived from the north to try and flank the existing Ukrainian national forces before NATO could join the fight. The Americans were moving through Poland, but had concerns about the security of their supply lines.

Civilians are a fact of life on the modern battlefield, and they are present in The Next Wars. Neutral and benign, local civilians may come to support one faction or another based on the behavior of the forces of the battlefield. Headquarters units also enable players to deploy command cards that allow give units special actions or bonuses on the battlefield. Simulating the staff planning process, the mission cards allow units to prepare and rehearse certain missions for later execution.

Name: Warfare in the Ancient World: Wargames Rules for the Period 3000 B.C. to 500 A.D.
Description:
Subtitled: wargames rules for the period 3000 BC to 500 AD

Miniatures rules in a 65 page A4 rules book with pull out quick reference sheet.

Troops classified for equipment, armour, training, morale and basic type.   Includes classifications for prominent troop types from many armies in the back of the rules. Armies are split up into divisions.

Combat uses factors for troop type and situation and charts to calculate losses.  Movement is according to pre-written orders.

Includes sections dealing with sieges and naval operations.

Name: Primaries: 1980
Description:
Players move around a Monopoly-like board in which each space represents a state, fund raising and spending the money to open campaign offices.  Each office on a state increases the chances of collecting votes during primaries which are held on a fixed calendar at certain turns of the game.  Movement is 0-5 squares at player's choice, but an end-of-turn die role introduces random events.

Strategy consists primarily of shrewd choice of states in which to compete -- you can spread over many small states, concentrate on a few large ones, or make some attempt at a hybrid.  Player vs. player interaction is limited; the end-of-turn event roll gives you a 1/6th chance of being able to send an opponent to the Federal Election Commission space (which is, effectively, jail).
 Components, unusually, include a cork board and colored pins. The game otherwise has poor production values by modern standards (it appears to have been a self-published one-shot and is more than 25 years old), but is redeemed by a simple and effective design.

This is a quick-playing, light-weight, clever game that exploits its topic well and is worth two or three plays in the unlikely event that you can find a copy.

It is regrettable that the game does not credit its designer, and the name of the publisher is an obvious joke punning on "gerrymander"

This game is long out of print and rare.

Name: The World Cup Game:  Expansion Set 3
Description:
The World Cup Game - Expansion 3 was released in February 2008 and includes four more boards to add another angle to your World Cup experience. 
This expansion set concentrates on two of the stranger formats for the World Cup. Brazil 1950 has 13 teams divided 'very' unequally due to the refusal of some teams who qualified, to turn up for the event! It was also the only World Cup to be decided on a Final Pool format.
Mexico 1986 and Italy 1990 included 24 teams from which 16 progressed to the next stage - the Round of 16. Out of the 6 groups of 4, even the 4 best third place teams progressed! Both of these games mean that it is unlikely that anyone will be eliminated in the first round. The rules include the table which determines which third place teams play which group winners!
Also included is a Euro 2008 game which allows players to choose their own team rankings. The designer has put his reputation on the line with pre-determined rankings to use if you don't want to create your own.

Expands:

    The World Cup Game

Name: Venusian Bowling
Description:
102,000 years ago (2000 years before the Martian civilization reached its peak) the Venusians crushed the Martians early pyramids with their superior polyhedron shape. Today the only thing that remains of the Venusians is this game...

Players setup the pyramids in a cross formation touching each other, centered on an overturned mouse pad and role a D20 at the pyramids. Scoring more points for knocking down more pyramids. Players get additional balls for throwing strikes.

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces

Name: Martian Shogi
Description:
Players sit at opposite sides of the board. The pieces are oriented to point away from a player to show that that player controls them. The remaining pyramids are placed in a common area off the board that is available to both players. To show that neither player owns any of these pyramids initially, they should be in this "global stash" standing upright. There are also two initially empty off-board "prisoner areas", one near each player, to hold the pieces captured by that player.  The object of the game is to capture all of an opponent's Monarchs (large blue pieces). There are twelve different pieces in the game, each with a unique movement.

Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 1st Competition

Name: Moscow Ice
Description:
Moscow Ice is an abstract strategy game similar to Chinese checkers. To play you will need a different coloured Icehouse stash for each player  and a (modified) 8×8 Chessboard. [The game is played on a central 6×6 grid with each side extended by a centrally placed single row of 4 – this is an 8x8 Chessboard minus three Squares in each corner.

Links to rules for both the original Moscow Ice and the game creator's variants (Mega-Multi Ice!, Multi-Moscow Ice, and Maxi-Moscow Ice!) are available HERE.

Name: Turning Points
Description:
On each turn a player will place a single piece in a space on the board, lying down and pointing to an adjacent space (or off the board). If there is another piece in the space pointed to, that piece is rotated one notch clockwise (i.e. 90 degrees on a square grid, 60 degrees on a hex grid.) If the pieces just rotated now points to a space that contains a piece, that piece is also rotated one notch clockwise, and if that piece now points to a space which contains a piece… This process is continued until a piece points to an empty space or off the edge of the board. Then play passes to the next player to the left.

Rules Link

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 1st Competition

Name: Missile Command
Description:
Each player secretly chooses 24 “Missiles” (pyramids), eight of each size, and combines them into a Battery of eight “Missile Silos” (stacks of pyramids).

Each player also secretly conceals their President and Vice President tokens under one or two of the Missile Silos.

Players take turns launching one Missile (removing one pyramid from one stack) at one specific exposed Missile in an enemy Battery. Both pyramids are discarded exposing whatever is underneath.

Eventually, the Silo protecting the President is exhausted and the President herself is exposed. Once exposed, the President can be struck by an enemy Missile, eliminating the owning player.

Play continues until only one President remains (one player winner) – OR – all remaining Presidents are exposed at the same time (a draw).

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 1st Competition

Name: Hunt
Description:
Hunt is a game for 2-4 players hunting each other across a moving play field of a deadly nature using any two Treehouse sets. Players move large and medium pyramids around the board, creating a maze, while trying to keep their stack of small pyramids alive.

Rules Link

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 7th Competition

Name: That's So Raven: Girl Talk
Description:
Draw a card and read it out loud to your friends. Do you think the answer is totally YES? Do your friends say NO way, no how? Vote for what you think the correct answer is and see what Raven had to say about it. If your answer matches Raven's final answer, collect a gem.

The first player to place 5 gems on the gameboard is the winner Will it be you? Just Ask Raven!

Contents: Raven's crystal ball game unit, 46 question cards, 24 fortune disks, 20 plastic tokens, 4 Ask Again cards, 4 Yes/No chips, gameboard, instructions.

Name: Storm of Arrows: Late Medieval Europe at War – Field of Glory Gaming Companion
Description:
The second army supplement for the Field of Glory: Ancient and Medieval Wargaming Rules miniatures wargame. This supplement covers the armies of late medieval Europe. There are 26 separate lists, each with a sample starter army and point cost chart for making your own force.

The book itself is 88 pages printed in full color with photos of miniatures and paintings from various other Osprey books used throughout.

Armies included:
- Hundred Years' War English (Continental)
- Hundred Years' War English (Britain)
- Wars of the Roses English
- Medieval Welsh
- Later Medieval Scots (Britain)
- Later Medieval Scots (Continental)
- Later Scots Isles and Highlanders
- Later Anglo-Irish
- Medieval Irish
- Medieval French
- Ordonnance French
- Free Company
- Navarrese
- Later Low Countries
- Medieval Burgundian
- Ordonnance Burgundian
- Swiss
- Later Medieval German
- Later Medieval Danish
- Later Medieval Swedish
- Condotta Italian
- Medieval Crown of Aragon
- Medieval Portugese
- Medieval Castilian
- Santa Hemandad Nueva Castilian
- Later Granadine

From back of the book:

In peace prepare for war.

Fight with brave knights, stalwart men-at-arms and deadly archers in the epic battles of the late medieval era with Storm of Arrows, the Field of Glory gaming comapnion.  Command noble and commoner alike as they struggle in armour, mud, and blood across the battlefields of Europe, with lance, sword, pike, and bow.  Complete with organization charts for hundreds of accurately researched troop types, detailed historical overview and supporting maps and artwork, this addition to the core rulebook will dramatically enhance your gameplay.

Storm of Arrows is a companion to Field of Glory, the historical miniatures tabletop wargaming rules system for ancient and medieval wargaming.  To play the rules you will need a copy of Field of Glory.

Name: Scrabble The Shrek Edition
Description:
Scrabble The Shrek Edition is a themed Scrabble game around DreamWorks's Shrek series. The game features various characters from the Shrek series on the board as bonus zones.

The game is unique from regular Scrabble by the way it is shaped. Instead of being square, the board is shaped around Shrek's head, including a rounded bottom and top, with two rounded antenna by the sides of his head. There is also special rules that give bonuses for spelling words related to the Shrek series such as "Donkey," "Fiona," and "Shrek."
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Puss in Boots

Name: Hideyoshi's Battles at the Summit
Description:
This game utilizes a hybrid card-driven/area-impulse system. The game covers the Battles of Yamazaki and Shizugatake in 1582 and 1583 respectively, in which Toyotomi Hideyoshi's victories established his position as successor to Oda Nobunaga.

The game comes with two separate A2-sized maps for the two separate battles, 198 counters and 32 cards.

Name: Pink Panther
Description:
Pink Panther is being held in a zoo, guarded by several zoo guards. Scattered around the zoo are eight face-down tool cards (crowbar, ladder, lifebuoy etc.) which are needed to release the Pink Panther, depending on what cage he's in. Moving around by the die roll, players must find the right tool and release Pink Panther from the cage, at which point they will start playing as the Pink Panther, trying to escape from the zoo. If a player lands on a zoo guard while carrying a tool they have been spotted and must replace the tool on the board; if they land on a guard as the Pink Panther, the guard puts him into the nearest cage, and he must be released again.

The player who manages to escape from the zoo with the Pink Panther wins.

There's also a rules variant where the game is played over several rounds in teams of two players.

This is Ravensburger game no. 00 147 7 (601 5 492 2)

Name: Intrigue in the Three Kingdoms
Description:
A multi-player Three Kingdoms game where players take on the persona of famous heroes of the Three Kingdoms history and have secret victory objectives to achieve.

Components:
1 Map
48 cards
198 counters
Rulebook
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: Cars Champion Checkers
Description:
This is the classic game of Checkers but it includes 3 enhanced gameplay options where kids can use special abilities attributed to various pieces associated with the Cars characters.

There are 4 ways to play:
Normal checkers - Plays with standard checker rules.
King Conflict - When a checker is "kinged", flip it over to reveal its special Cars skill.
Power Challenge - A head-to-head challenge where all the Cars characters are revealed and you must decide when to use their special skills.
Ultimate Race - You know which spaces your Cars characters are hidden on, but does your opponent?

Each side has 7 pieces with stickers of different Cars characters on them, normally hidden from view by a flip-up "hood ornament mover" mechanism, along with a number of plain checkers pieces without stickers.  The Cars characters represented include:
Lightning McQueen (Turbo Jump power)
Sally (Caution Cone power)
Guido (Repair power)
Mater (Tow Rope power)
King (Speed power)
Doc (Drafting power)
Luigi (Fender Rub power)

Name: UBOS: El Juego
Description:
UBOS (Ultimate Book of Spells)

Based in the children's animated television series which began production in 2001.

A game of magic and enchantments. In the center of the Earth are Cassy, Gus and Verne with UBOS. If you come there first you will be able to share with them infinite adventures, floods of magic and enchantments, in their fight against the Supreme Wizard Zarlak and his perverse followers.

The game objective is to be the first one putting both player pieces in the center of the board, in UBOS's place, where Cassy, Gus and Verne are waiting.

Content:

- 1 Board
- 1 Instructions card for the places
- 8 player pieces in 4 different colors
- 2 dices

Name: Link 26
Description:
Millions of words, 100 categories and only 26 letters make Link 26 one of the most challenging new games of the year! Players must quickly think of words that link together using the letter drawn for a specific category.

For example, the category is "Things That Make Music." The letter "F" is drawn. Player A says "Flute". Now player B must use the last letter in that word to come up with the next thing that makes music... how about Euphonium?

Can be played as a solitaire game or with 2 or more players.

Name: Fingers Harry
Description: Game is advertized as the Wildest, Wackiest most Wonderful Magnetic Chase Game Yet. Its a game of cops and robbers. Its trying to keep the robber from getting the money or trying to catch the robbber or trying to keep the robber from catching you.
